intro: Campanula corcontica, commonly known as the bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are slightly hairy. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Campanula corcontica is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate.
